purpose: To maximize the number of successful service and product changes by ensuring that risks have been properly assessed, authorizing changes to proceed, and managing the change schedule.
description: Change enablement ensures that all changes to services and service components are authorized and performed in a controlled manner, minimizing the risk of incidents and ensuring that services continue to meet agreed requirements.

key_concepts.change: The addition, modification, or removal of anything that could have a direct or indirect effect on services
key_concepts.change_request: A description of a proposed change along with details such as what, why, where, when, and how
key_concepts.change_schedule: A calendar that shows planned and agreed changes
key_concepts.emergency_change: A change that must be implemented urgently to resolve an incident or security issue
key_concepts.standard_change: A low-risk, pre-authorized change that is well understood and fully documented

scope: All changes to service components under organizational control
Changes to processes, procedures, and documentation
Changes to suppliers and supply chains
Changes to metrics and measurement methods

standard_changes.description: Pre-approved changes that are low risk, relatively common, and follow a procedure

normal_changes.description: Changes that need to go through the complete change management process

emergency_changes.description: Changes that must be implemented quickly to resolve critical issues

key_activities.description: Receive and evaluate change requests for validity and completeness
Obtain approval from appropriate change authority
Develop detailed plans for change implementation
Execute the planned change according to schedule
Evaluate change success and formally close change record

change_authorities.description: Group responsible for authorizing changes within their scope
change_authorities.scope: Major changes with significant business impact

change_authorities.description: Subset of CAB for urgent change decisions
Individual with expertise in specific technical domain

key_metrics.description: Percentage of changes implemented successfully without causing incidents
Percentage of changes classified as emergency
Number of changes that result in incidents
key_metrics.measurement: Count of changes linked to subsequent incidents

key_metrics.description: Time from change request to implementation
key_metrics.measurement: Total lead time / Number of changes
Count of approved but not yet implemented changes

integration_with_practices.incident_management: Changes may be needed to resolve incidents
integration_with_practices.problem_management: Changes implement permanent fixes for problems

success_factors: Clear change categorization and authorization matrix
Good relationship between change management and other practices

norwegian_context.language: Change documentation and communication in Norwegian
norwegian_context.business_hours: Changes scheduled around Norwegian business operations
